title: paisaje: landscape analysis
text: can install development version paisaje GitHub :
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ManuelSpinola/paisaje")

title: paisaje: landscape analysis
text: basic example shows use package: Let’s bring sf object Create h3 grid resolution 4 Make map
code: library(paisaje) library(ggplot2) library(sf) library(h3jsr) nc = st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package="sf")) ## Reading layer `nc' from data source  ##   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/sf/shape/nc.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' ## Simple feature collection with 100 features and 14 fields ## Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON ## Dimension:     XY ## Bounding box:  xmin: -84.32385 ymin: 33.88199 xmax: -75.45698 ymax: 36.58965 ## Geodetic CRS:  NAD27 h3_grid_nc <- get_h3_grid(nc, resolution = 4) ggplot() +   theme_minimal() +   geom_sf(data = nc, color = "blue", linewidth = 0.5) +   geom_sf(data = h3_grid_nc, alpha = 0.4, color = "coral", linewidth = 0.5)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Manuel Spínola. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Spínola M (2024). paisaje. version 0.1.0, https://manuelspinola.github.io/paisaje/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {paisaje},   author = {Manuel Spínola},   year = {2024},   note = {version 0.1.0},   url = {https://manuelspinola.github.io/paisaje/}, }

title: paisaje
text: paisaje: Tools spatial landscape/habitat analysis.

title: paisaje
text: paisaje R package calculating landscape metrics performing spatial analysis raster vector data, including H3 hexagonal grids. provides tools quantify habitat structure, fragmentation, landscape patterns, supporting ecological research, environmental monitoring, spatial data integration using hierarchical grid systems. Key features include: Calculation landscape metrics categorical raster layers Generation analysis H3 hexagonal grids spatial modeling Integration spatial packages like terra sf Flexible extraction metrics different spatial resolutions Functions habitat landscape characterization combining powerful spatial analysis tools user-friendly API, paisaje facilitates landscape ecology studies, habitat assessment, spatial modeling workflows.

title: paisaje
text: can install development version paisaje GitHub using one following methods:
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("ManuelSpinola/paisaje") # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ManuelSpinola/paisaje") install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ManuelSpinola/paisaje")

title: paisaje
text: package released MIT License.

what: Calculate 5 information theory landscape metrics — calculate_it_metrics
title: Calculate 5 information theory landscape metrics — calculate_it_metrics
text: function allow calculate 5 information theory landscape metrics

title: Calculate 5 information theory landscape metrics — calculate_it_metrics
code: calculate_it_metrics(landscape_raster, aoi_sf)

title: Calculate 5 information theory landscape metrics — calculate_it_metrics
text: landscape_raster categorical raster object: SpatRaster. aoi_sf spatial area interest sf object.

title: Calculate 5 information theory landscape metrics — calculate_it_metrics
text: sf object

title: Calculate 5 information theory landscape metrics — calculate_it_metrics
text: Calculate landscape metrics: condent, ent, joinent, mutinf, relmutinf.

title: Calculate 5 information theory landscape metrics — calculate_it_metrics
text: wrapper function "sample_lsm"  landscapemetrics package (see References)

title: Calculate 5 information theory landscape metrics — calculate_it_metrics
text: Hesselbarth, M.H.K., Sciaini, M., , K.., Wiegand, K., Nowosad, J. 2019. landscapemetrics: open‐source R tool calculate landscape metrics. Ecography, 42: 1648-1657 (v2.1.4). Nowosad J., TF Stepinski. 2019. Information theory consistent framework quantification classification landscape patterns. https://doi.org/10.1007/s10980-019-00830-x Information theory-based framework analysis landscape patterns

title: Calculate 5 information theory landscape metrics — calculate_it_metrics
code: # \donttest{ nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf")) #> Reading layer `nc' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/sf/shape/nc.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 100 features and 14 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -84.32385 ymin: 33.88199 xmax: -75.45698 ymax: 36.58965 #> Geodetic CRS:  NAD27 nc <- sf::st_transform(nc, crs = 4326)  clc <- terra::rast(system.file("sao_miguel/clc2018_v2020_20u1.tif",   package = "exactextractr"))  bbox <- sf::st_bbox(clc) |>   sf::st_as_sfc() |>   sf::st_as_sf()  h3_bbox <- paisaje::get_h3_grid(bbox, resolution = 6) #> Warning: attribute variables are assumed to be spatially constant throughout all geometries  result_sf <- paisaje::calculate_it_metrics(clc, h3_bbox) #> Warning: The 'perecentage_inside' is below 90% for at least one buffer. #> Warning: Please use 'check_landscape()' to ensure the input data is valid. # }

what: Count Points within Polygons by Species — count_points_in_polygons
title: Count Points within Polygons by Species — count_points_in_polygons
text: Counts number points per species within polygon. points dataset contains `species` column, separate column created species counts inside polygon. Spaces species names replaced underscores naming columns. function particularly useful ecological studies species different spatial distributions. accounts possibility species may present polygons, producing zero counts cases.

title: Count Points within Polygons by Species — count_points_in_polygons
code: count_points_in_polygons(points_sf, polygons_sf)

title: Count Points within Polygons by Species — count_points_in_polygons
text: points_sf `sf` object containing point geometries. Must include `species` column. polygons_sf `sf` object containing polygon geometries.

title: Count Points within Polygons by Species — count_points_in_polygons
text: `sf` object containing original polygons additional columns species count. Column names follow format `species_name_count`, spaces replaced underscores.

title: Count Points within Polygons by Species — count_points_in_polygons
text: function performs spatial join count occurrences species within polygon. species absent polygon, count zero. approach allows flexible analysis species distributions across landscape units.

title: Count Points within Polygons by Species — count_points_in_polygons
code: # \donttest{ library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.12.1, GDAL 3.8.4, PROJ 9.4.0; sf_use_s2() is TRUE  points_sf <- st_as_sf(data.frame(   id = 1:6,   species = c("Panthera onca", "Panthera onca", "Felis catus",               "Felis catus", "Felis catus", "Panthera leo"),   x = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6),   y = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6) ), coords = c("x", "y"), crs = 4326)  polygons_sf <- st_as_sf(data.frame(   id = 1:2,   geometry = st_sfc(     st_polygon(list(rbind(c(0,0), c(3,0), c(3,3), c(0,3), c(0,0)))),     st_polygon(list(rbind(c(3,3), c(6,3), c(6,6), c(3,6), c(3,3))))   ) ), crs = 4326)  result <- count_points_in_polygons(points_sf, polygons_sf) print(result) #> Simple feature collection with 2 features and 4 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 0 ymin: 0 xmax: 6 ymax: 6 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>   id                       geometry Panthera_onca Felis_catus Panthera_leo #> 1  1 POLYGON ((0 0, 3 0, 3 3, 0 ...             2           1            0 #> 2  2 POLYGON ((3 3, 6 3, 6 6, 3 ...             0           3            1 # }

code: cr_outline_c

what: Create Categorical Land Cover Raster from Copernicus ESA WorldCover Data — create_cat_esa_10m
title: Create Categorical Land Cover Raster from Copernicus ESA WorldCover Data — create_cat_esa_10m
text: function takes `SpatRaster` object containing Copernicus ESA WorldCover land cover data, reclassifies categorical land cover classes based predefined schemes, returns resulting categorical raster.

title: Create Categorical Land Cover Raster from Copernicus ESA WorldCover Data — create_cat_esa_10m
code: create_cat_esa_10m(land_cover)

title: Create Categorical Land Cover Raster from Copernicus ESA WorldCover Data — create_cat_esa_10m
text: land_cover `SpatRaster` object representing input land cover raster Copernicus ESA WorldCover. raster contain land cover classes defined Copernicus program.

title: Create Categorical Land Cover Raster from Copernicus ESA WorldCover Data — create_cat_esa_10m
text: `SpatRaster` object containing reclassified   categorical land cover raster. pixel   category corresponding defined land cover type.

title: Create Categorical Land Cover Raster from Copernicus ESA WorldCover Data — create_cat_esa_10m
text: function uses predefined classification scheme ESA WorldCover data, assigning numeric categorical values represent different land cover types. resulting raster can used spatial analysis landscape ecology studies.

title: Create Categorical Land Cover Raster from Copernicus ESA WorldCover Data — create_cat_esa_10m
text: Zanaga, D., Van De Kerchove, R., De Keersmaecker, W., et al. (2021).   ESA WorldCover 10 m 2020 v100.   https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5571936 Zanaga, D., Van De Kerchove, R., Daems, D., et al. (2022).   ESA WorldCover 10 m 2021 v200.   https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7254221 ESA WorldCover project 2020 2021.   Contains modified Copernicus Sentinel data processed ESA WorldCover consortium.   ESA WorldCover

title: Create Categorical Land Cover Raster from Copernicus ESA WorldCover Data — create_cat_esa_10m
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Assuming 'land_cover_raster' is a SpatRaster object from ESA WorldCover cat_raster <- create_cat_esa_10m(land_cover_raster) } # }

what: Extract categorical raster values by polygons or hexagons — extract_cat_raster
title: Extract categorical raster values by polygons or hexagons — extract_cat_raster
text: Extracts categorical raster values (e.g., land cover classes) polygon given grid (e.g., H3 hexagons administrative units). returns either proportion category within polygon raw counts.

title: Extract categorical raster values by polygons or hexagons — extract_cat_raster
code: extract_cat_raster(spat_raster_cat, sf_hex_grid, proportion = TRUE)

title: Extract categorical raster values by polygons or hexagons — extract_cat_raster
text: spat_raster_cat categorical raster class `SpatRaster` **terra** package. sf_hex_grid object class `sf` representing polygons (e.g., hexagonal grid). proportion Logical. `TRUE` (default), returns proportion category within polygon. `FALSE`, returns counts instead.

title: Extract categorical raster values by polygons or hexagons — extract_cat_raster
text: `sf` object extracted values joined input grid. polygon contain calculated proportions counts categorical raster values fall within area.

title: Extract categorical raster values by polygons or hexagons — extract_cat_raster
text: function uses `exactextractr::exact_extract()` accurately compute overlap polygons raster cells. Invalid geometries automatically fixed using `sf::st_make_valid()`, `POLYGON` `MULTIPOLYGON` geometries processed.

title: Extract categorical raster values by polygons or hexagons — extract_cat_raster
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # Example categorical raster r <- terra::rast(nrows = 10, ncols = 10) terra::values(r) <- sample(1:3, terra::ncell(r), replace = TRUE)  # Example grid (hexagons) bbox <- sf::st_as_sfc(sf::st_bbox(terra::as.polygons(r))) hex <- sf::st_make_grid(bbox, cellsize = 0.2, square = FALSE) hex_sf <- sf::st_sf(ID = 1:length(hex), geometry = hex)  # Extract proportions of land cover classes per hexagon result <- extract_cat_raster(r, hex_sf, proportion = TRUE) } # }

what: Extract Numeric Raster Values by Polygons — extract_num_raster
title: Extract Numeric Raster Values by Polygons — extract_num_raster
text: Extracts numeric raster values polygon sf object. Uses exactextractr compute weighted mean using area overlap.

title: Extract Numeric Raster Values by Polygons — extract_num_raster
code: extract_num_raster(spat_raster_multi, sf_hex_grid)

title: Extract Numeric Raster Values by Polygons — extract_num_raster
text: spat_raster_multi SpatRaster object (single multilayer numeric raster). sf_hex_grid sf object polygon geometries (e.g., H3 hexagons).

title: Extract Numeric Raster Values by Polygons — extract_num_raster
text: sf object additional columns raster layer.

title: Extract Numeric Raster Values by Polygons — extract_num_raster
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  r <- terra::rast(system.file("raster/bio.tif", package = "spData")) grid_sf <- get_h3_grid(st_as_sf(st_bbox(r)), resolution = 6) result_sf <- extract_num_raster(r, grid_sf) head(result_sf) } # }

what: Download ESA WorldCover land cover data — get_esa_10m
title: Download ESA WorldCover land cover data — get_esa_10m
text: Downloads ESA WorldCover land cover data 10 m resolution specified area interest (AOI) year. Useful landscape ecology studies, environmental analyses, habitat mapping.

title: Download ESA WorldCover land cover data — get_esa_10m
code: get_esa_10m(aoi_sf, year = 2020, output_folder = NULL)

title: Download ESA WorldCover land cover data — get_esa_10m
text: aoi_sf `sf` sf object defining area interest (AOI). can country, state, custom boundary. year `numeric` Year land cover data. Available: - 2020: ESA WorldCover 10 m 2020 v100 - 2021: ESA WorldCover 10 m 2021 v200 output_folder `character` Directory data files saved. Default "." (current working directory).

title: Download ESA WorldCover land cover data — get_esa_10m
text: `SpatRaster` raster object containing land cover classification   specified AOI year. raster values correspond land cover classes   defined ESA WorldCover classification scheme.

title: Download ESA WorldCover land cover data — get_esa_10m
text: function downloads global land cover raster data produced ESA WorldCover project. downloaded file can large (hundreds MB), processing may take several minutes depending AOI size internet connection speed.

title: Download ESA WorldCover land cover data — get_esa_10m
text: Zanaga, D., Van De Kerchove, R., De Keersmaecker, W., et al. (2021).   ESA WorldCover 10 m 2020 v100. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5571936 Zanaga, D., Van De Kerchove, R., Daems, D., et al. (2022).   ESA WorldCover 10 m 2021 v200. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7254221

title: Download ESA WorldCover land cover data — get_esa_10m
code: # \donttest{ library(sf) nc <- st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package="sf")) #> Reading layer `nc' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/sf/shape/nc.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 100 features and 14 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -84.32385 ymin: 33.88199 xmax: -75.45698 ymax: 36.58965 #> Geodetic CRS:  NAD27 get_esa_10m(nc, year = 2021, output_folder = tempdir()) #> Failed to download: what: Generate an H3 Hexagonal Grid for an sf Object — get_h3_grid
title: Generate an H3 Hexagonal Grid for an sf Object — get_h3_grid
text: Generates hexagonal grid H3 cells specified resolution intersect given `sf` object. wrapper functions h3jsr package.

title: Generate an H3 Hexagonal Grid for an sf Object — get_h3_grid
code: get_h3_grid(sf_object, resolution = 6, expand_factor = 0.1)

title: Generate an H3 Hexagonal Grid for an sf Object — get_h3_grid
text: sf_object (sf) sf object defining area interest. Must valid coordinate reference system (CRS). resolution (integer) H3 resolution level (1–16). Default 6. Lower values produce fewer, larger hexagons (faster processing, coarser grid). expand_factor (numeric) Expands bounding box ensure coverage. Default 0.1.

title: Generate an H3 Hexagonal Grid for an sf Object — get_h3_grid
text: (sf) sf object containing hexagonal grid polygons   covering input area. polygon represents H3 cell specified   resolution, column containing H3 index.

title: Generate an H3 Hexagonal Grid for an sf Object — get_h3_grid
text: Reducing resolution (e.g., 5 6) can greatly reduce processing time memory usage, especially large AOIs. decrease resolution increases size individual hexagons exponentially.

title: Generate an H3 Hexagonal Grid for an sf Object — get_h3_grid
code: # \donttest{ library(sf) nc <- st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package="sf")) #> Reading layer `nc' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/sf/shape/nc.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 100 features and 14 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -84.32385 ymin: 33.88199 xmax: -75.45698 ymax: 36.58965 #> Geodetic CRS:  NAD27 h3_grid_sf <- get_h3_grid(nc, resolution = 6) #> Warning: attribute variables are assumed to be spatially constant throughout all geometries # }

what: Download and Retrieve Nightlight Data — get_nightlight_data
title: Download and Retrieve Nightlight Data — get_nightlight_data
text: Downloads nightlight data Earth Observation Group's website. scrapes website locate download latest available nightlight dataset specified year month.

title: Download and Retrieve Nightlight Data — get_nightlight_data
code: get_nightlight_data(   year,   month,   version = "v10",   destination_dir = NULL,   timeout = 1200 )

title: Download and Retrieve Nightlight Data — get_nightlight_data
text: year `numeric` o `character` year download nightlight data (e.g., 2020). month `numeric` o `character` Month year (1–12). formatted two digits (e.g., `"03"` March). version `character` Nightlight data version. Default `"v10"`. destination_dir `character` Directory downloaded `.tif` file saved. Default current working directory `"."`. timeout `numeric` Timeout seconds download. Default `1200` seconds.

title: Download and Retrieve Nightlight Data — get_nightlight_data
text: `character` o `NULL` Path downloaded `.tif` file.   Returns `NULL` file found error occurred.

title: Download and Retrieve Nightlight Data — get_nightlight_data
text: function constructs appropriate URL specified year, month, data version, scrapes directory listing locate latest available `.tif` file. downloads saves file `destination_dir`. function useful retrieving nightlight data studies involving human activity, urbanization, environmental monitoring.

title: Download and Retrieve Nightlight Data — get_nightlight_data
code: # \donttest{   # Download nightlight data for March 2021   file_path <- get_nightlight_data(2021, 3) #> No destination_dir provided. Using temporary directory: /tmp/RtmpMrCrva #> Scraping URL: https://eogdata.mines.edu/nighttime_light/monthly_notile/v10/2021/202103/vcmslcfg/ #> Error during web scraping or downloading: No suitable .tif files found for the specified year and month.   print(file_path) #> NULL # }

what: Retrieve species occurrence records within an Area of Interest — get_records
title: Retrieve species occurrence records within an Area of Interest — get_records
text: Retrieves species occurrence records specified data providers within given Area Interest (AOI). results returned `sf` object containing point geometries. Duplicates can removed based geometry. wrapper `occ` function spocc package.

title: Retrieve species occurrence records within an Area of Interest — get_records
code: get_records(species, aoi_sf, providers = NULL,   limit = 500, remove_duplicates = FALSE, date = NULL)

title: Retrieve species occurrence records within an Area of Interest — get_records
text: species (`character`) Vector species names query. aoi_sf (`sf`) `sf` object representing Area Interest. Must valid CRS. providers (`character`) Data providers query (e.g., `"gbif"`, `"inat"`). Default `NULL`, queries available providers. limit (`integer`) Maximum number records retrieve per provider. Default 500. remove_duplicates (`logical`) Whether remove duplicate geometries. Default `FALSE`. date (`character`) Vector length two specifying date range (e.g., `c("YYYY-MM-DD", "YYYY-MM-DD")`). Records outside range excluded. Default `NULL` (date filtering).

title: Retrieve species occurrence records within an Area of Interest — get_records
text: (`sf`) `sf` object containing species occurrence records   within specified AOI match query criteria. Returns `NULL`   records found input parameters invalid.

title: Retrieve species occurrence records within an Area of Interest — get_records
text: function simplifies retrieving occurrence records wrapping functionality `spocc::occ` function. handles AOI spatial filtering optional removal duplicates.

title: Retrieve species occurrence records within an Area of Interest — get_records
code: # \donttest{ library(sf) nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package="sf")) #> Reading layer `nc' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/sf/shape/nc.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 100 features and 14 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -84.32385 ymin: 33.88199 xmax: -75.45698 ymax: 36.58965 #> Geodetic CRS:  NAD27 records <- get_records(   species = "Lynx rufus",   aoi_sf = nc,   providers = c("gbif", "inat"),   limit = 200 ) #> Warning: attribute variables are assumed to be spatially constant throughout all geometries head(records) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 18 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -81.58028 ymin: 36.29134 xmax: -81.44359 ymax: 36.37224 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 6 × 19 #>   name   prov  date       key    AREA PERIMETER CNTY_ CNTY_ID NAME  FIPS  FIPSNO #>   <chr>  <chr> <date>     <chr> <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl> <chr> <chr>  <dbl> #> 1 Lynx … gbif  2025-09-21 5831… 0.114      1.44  1825    1825 Ashe  37009  37009 #> 2 Lynx … gbif  2023-01-02 4516… 0.114      1.44  1825    1825 Ashe  37009  37009 #> 3 Lynx … gbif  2023-03-29 4171… 0.114      1.44  1825    1825 Ashe  37009  37009 #> 4 Lynx … gbif  2023-03-10 4171… 0.114      1.44  1825    1825 Ashe  37009  37009 #> 5 Lynx … gbif  2023-03-06 4172… 0.114      1.44  1825    1825 Ashe  37009  37009 #> 6 Lynx … gbif  2023-04-28 4171… 0.114      1.44  1825    1825 Ashe  37009  37009 #> # ℹ 8 more variables: CRESS_ID <int>, BIR74 <dbl>, SID74 <dbl>, NWBIR74 <dbl>, #> #   BIR79 <dbl>, SID79 <dbl>, NWBIR79 <dbl>, geometry <POINT [°]> # }

what: Retrieve species records aggregated by H3 hexagons — get_records_by_hexagon
title: Retrieve species records aggregated by H3 hexagons — get_records_by_hexagon
text: Downloads species occurrence data within specified Area Interest (AOI) aggregates records H3 hexagonal grid cells given resolution. Returns `sf` object one polygon per hexagon columns containing species occurrence counts.

title: Retrieve species records aggregated by H3 hexagons — get_records_by_hexagon
code: get_records_by_hexagon(   species, aoi_sf, res = 6,   providers = NULL, remove_duplicates = FALSE,   date = NULL, expand_factor = 0.1, limit = 500 )

title: Retrieve species records aggregated by H3 hexagons — get_records_by_hexagon
text: species character vector. Species names query. aoi_sf sf object. Area Interest polygon. res integer. H3 resolution level (1–16). Default: 6. providers character vector. Data providers query. Default: NULL (). remove_duplicates logical. Remove duplicate records. Default: FALSE. date character vector length two. Start end dates filtering records. expand_factor numeric. Expand AOI bounding box. Default: 0.1. limit integer. Maximum number occurrence records per species. Default: 500.

title: Retrieve species records aggregated by H3 hexagons — get_records_by_hexagon
text: sf object. H3 hex grid species occurrence counts.

title: Retrieve species records aggregated by H3 hexagons — get_records_by_hexagon
text: function useful spatial biodiversity analyses data aggregated uniform spatial grid. H3 grid system enables multi-resolution analysis efficient spatial summarization point occurrence data.

title: Retrieve species records aggregated by H3 hexagons — get_records_by_hexagon
code: # \donttest{ library(sf) nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package="sf")) #> Reading layer `nc' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/sf/shape/nc.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 100 features and 14 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -84.32385 ymin: 33.88199 xmax: -75.45698 ymax: 36.58965 #> Geodetic CRS:  NAD27 hex_counts <- get_records_by_hexagon(   species = c("Lynx rufus"),   aoi_sf = nc,   res = 6,   limit = 200 ) #> Warning: attribute variables are assumed to be spatially constant throughout all geometries print(hex_counts) #> Simple feature collection with 5705 features and 2 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -84.32377 ymin: 33.88216 xmax: -75.45658 ymax: 36.58977 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> First 10 features: #>         h3_address Lynx_rufus                       geometry #> 1  862a99217ffffff          0 MULTIPOLYGON (((-81.70905 3... #> 2  862a992efffffff          0 MULTIPOLYGON (((-81.59396 3... #> 3  862a99227ffffff          0 MULTIPOLYGON (((-81.56735 3... #> 4  8644db267ffffff          0 MULTIPOLYGON (((-81.3142 36... #> 5  862a99237ffffff          0 MULTIPOLYGON (((-81.63851 3... #> 6  862a9930fffffff          0 MULTIPOLYGON (((-81.51986 3... #> 7  8644db34fffffff          0 MULTIPOLYGON (((-81.33057 3... #> 8  862a99247ffffff          2 MULTIPOLYGON (((-81.49647 3... #> 9  862a9931fffffff          0 MULTIPOLYGON (((-81.59216 3... #> 10 8644db35fffffff          1 MULTIPOLYGON (((-81.26766 3... # }

what: Download and process future environmental variables from WorldClim v2.1 — get_worldclim_future
title: Download and process future environmental variables from WorldClim v2.1 — get_worldclim_future
text: Downloads future climate data WorldClim based CMIP6 climate models SSP scenarios. data can retrieved various spatial resolutions optionally clipped specified area interest (AOI).

title: Download and process future environmental variables from WorldClim v2.1 — get_worldclim_future
code: get_worldclim_future(   var = "bioc",   res = "30s",   scenario = "585",   time_range = "2021-2040",   gcm = "ACCESS-CM2",   aoi = NULL,   retries = 3,   timeout = 300,   destination_dir = NULL )

title: Download and process future environmental variables from WorldClim v2.1 — get_worldclim_future
text: var character Climate variable download. Options: "bioc" — Bioclimatic variables (19 variables) "prec" — Precipitation "tavg" — Average temperature "tmin" — Minimum temperature "tmax" — Maximum temperature Default "bioc". res character Spatial resolution data. Options: "30s" — ~1 km (30 arc-seconds) "2.5m" — ~5 km (2.5 arc-minutes) "5m" — ~10 km (5 arc-minutes) "10m" — ~20 km (10 arc-minutes) Default "30s". scenario character SSP scenario. Options: "126" — SSP1-2.6 (low emissions) "245" — SSP2-4.5 (intermediate emissions) "370" — SSP3-7.0 (high emissions) "585" — SSP5-8.5 (high emissions) Default "585". time_range character Time period. Options: "2021-2040" "2041-2060" "2061-2080" "2081-2100" Default "2021-2040". gcm character General Circulation Model. Options: "ACCESS-CM2", "ACCESS-ESM1-5", "AWI-CM-1-1-MR", "BCC-CSM2-MR", "CanESM5", "CanESM5-CanOE", "CMCC-ESM2", "CNRM-CM6-1", "CNRM-CM6-1-HR", "CNRM-ESM2-1", "EC-Earth3-Veg", "EC-Earth3-Veg-LR", "FIO-ESM-2-0", "GFDL-ESM4", "GISS-E2-1-G", "GISS-E2-1-H", "HadGEM3-GC31-LL", "INM-CM4-8", "INM-CM5-0", "IPSL-CM6A-LR", "MIROC-ES2L", "MIROC6", "MPI-ESM1-2-HR", "MPI-ESM1-2-LR", "MRI-ESM2-0", "UKESM1-0-LL". Default "ACCESS-CM2". aoi sf SpatRaster Optional area interest clip data. Default NULL (clipping). retries integer Number attempts retry download case failure. Default 3. timeout numeric Download timeout seconds. Default 300. destination_dir character Directory downloaded data stored. Default NULL (uses temporary directory).

title: Download and process future environmental variables from WorldClim v2.1 — get_worldclim_future
text: SpatRaster object containing selected climate variables, optionally clipped specified AOI.

title: Download and process future environmental variables from WorldClim v2.1 — get_worldclim_future
text: Fick, S. E., & Hijmans, R. J. (2017). WorldClim 2: new 1-km spatial resolution climate surfaces global land areas. International Journal Climatology, 37(12), 4302–4315. doi:10.1002/joc.5086

title: Download and process future environmental variables from WorldClim v2.1 — get_worldclim_future
code: # \donttest{ nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf")) #> Reading layer `nc' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/sf/shape/nc.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 100 features and 14 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -84.32385 ymin: 33.88199 xmax: -75.45698 ymax: 36.58965 #> Geodetic CRS:  NAD27 nc <- sf::st_transform(nc, crs = 4326)  climate_future <- paisaje::get_worldclim_future(   var = "tmin", res = "10m", scenario = "585",   time_range = "2021-2040", gcm = "ACCESS-CM2", aoi = nc ) #> No destination_dir provided. Using temporary directory: /tmp/RtmpMrCrva #> Download URL: https://geodata.ucdavis.edu/cmip6/10m/ACCESS-CM2/ssp585/wc2.1_10m_tmin_ACCESS-CM2_ssp585_2021-2040.tif #> Raster saved at: /tmp/RtmpMrCrva/wc2.1_10m_tmin_ACCESS-CM2_ssp585_2021-2040.tif # }

what: Descargar y procesar variables climáticas históricas de WorldClim v2.1 — get_worldclim_historic
title: Descargar y procesar variables climáticas históricas de WorldClim v2.1 — get_worldclim_historic
text: Descarga datos climáticos históricos de WorldClim v2.1 y los procesa según los parámetros especificados. Soporta múltiples variables climáticas y resoluciones espaciales. Opcionalmente recorta los datos un área de interés (AOI).

title: Descargar y procesar variables climáticas históricas de WorldClim v2.1 — get_worldclim_historic
code: get_worldclim_historic(   var = "bio",   res = 10,   aoi = NULL,   retries = 3,   timeout = 300,   destination_dir = NULL )

title: Descargar y procesar variables climáticas históricas de WorldClim v2.1 — get_worldclim_historic
text: var Character. Variable climática descargar. Opciones: "bio" — Variables bioclimáticas. "tavg" — Temperatura media. "tmin" — Temperatura mínima. "tmax" — Temperatura máxima. "prec" — Precipitación. "srad" — Radiación solar. "wind" — Velocidad del viento. "vapr" — Presión de vapor. Por defecto: `"bio"`. res Numeric. Resolución espacial en minutos de arco. Valores válidos: `0.5`, `2.5`, `5`, `10`. Estos valores se mapean internamente cadenas aceptadas por WorldClim: 0.5 → "30s" 2.5 → "2.5m" 5   → "5m" 10  → "10m" Por defecto: `10`. aoi sf o SpatRaster opcional. Área de interés para recortar los datos. retries Integer. Número de intentos de descarga en caso de fallo. Por defecto: `3`. timeout Numeric. Tiempo máximo de descarga en segundos. Por defecto: `300`. destination_dir Character. Carpeta donde guardar los datos descargados. Si NULL, se usa un directorio temporal.

title: Descargar y procesar variables climáticas históricas de WorldClim v2.1 — get_worldclim_historic
text: Un objeto `SpatRaster` con las variables climáticas históricas.   Si se especifica `aoi`, los datos se recortan esa área.

title: Descargar y procesar variables climáticas históricas de WorldClim v2.1 — get_worldclim_historic
text: Fick, S. E., & Hijmans, R. J. (2017). WorldClim 2: new 1-km spatial resolution climate surfaces global land areas. International Journal Climatology, 37(12), 4302–4315. doi:10.1002/joc.5086

title: Descargar y procesar variables climáticas históricas de WorldClim v2.1 — get_worldclim_historic
code: # \donttest{ nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package="sf")) #> Reading layer `nc' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/sf/shape/nc.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 100 features and 14 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -84.32385 ymin: 33.88199 xmax: -75.45698 ymax: 36.58965 #> Geodetic CRS:  NAD27 nc <- sf::st_transform(nc, crs = 4326)  climate_historic <- get_worldclim_historic(   var = "tmin",   res = 5,   aoi = nc ) #> No destination_dir provided. Using temporary directory: /tmp/RtmpMrCrva #> Download URL: https://geodata.ucdavis.edu/climate/worldclim/2_1/base/wc2.1_5m_tmin.zip #> Raster saved at: /tmp/RtmpMrCrva/wc2.1_5m_tmin.tif # }

what: paisaje: Spatial and Environmental Data Tools for Landscape Ecology — paisaje-package
title: paisaje: Spatial and Environmental Data Tools for Landscape Ecology — paisaje-package
text: Provides functions landscape analysis data retrieval. package allows users download environmental variables global datasets (e.g., WorldClim, ESA WorldCover, Nighttime Lights), compute spatial landscape metrics using hexagonal grid system based H3 spatial index. useful ecological modeling, biodiversity studies, spatial data processing landscape ecology. Fick Hijmans (2017) doi:10.1002/joc.5086 . Zanaga et al. (2022) doi:10.5281/zenodo.7254221 . Uber Technologies Inc. (2022) "H3: Hexagonal hierarchical spatial index".

title: paisaje: Spatial and Environmental Data Tools for Landscape Ecology — paisaje-package
text: Maintainer: Manuel Spínola mspinola10@gmail.com (ORCID)
